intro: Phacelia congesta var. typica, commonly known as the clustered phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert regions. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Phacelia congesta var. typica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
